snippet: The monitor, Ahmed Shaheed, said Iran’s use of the death penalty was accelerating and that government critics faced harassment and prison.
abstract: Ahmed Shaheed, United Nations human rights monitor, reports despite Pres Hassan Rouhani's promises of a less restrictive society, human rights in Iran are deteriorating; cites rising number of executions and growing repression of political detractors as indicators.
lead_paragraph: The monitor, Ahmed Shaheed, said Iran’s use of the death penalty was accelerating and that government critics faced harassment and prison.

headline.main: U.N. Monitor Says Iran Is Worsening on Rights, Despite Pledges
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Iran: Rights Deteriorating Under Rouhani, U.N. Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
